Performance punishment is when being great at your job doesn’t get you a raise or recognition—it just gets you more work. Corporate spin doctors will tell you it’s an “honor” to be trusted with extra tasks, but let’s be real: it’s free labor disguised as a compliment. In this video, I break down the latest corporate propaganda article trying to gaslight employees into believing performance punishment is a reward. Spoiler: it’s not.

From bosses dangling fake promo
title: PERFORMANCE PUNISHMENT IS HERE! CONGRATULATIONS!
